Interface CheckerBoardConstants

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlphaBetaPlayer, CheckerBoard, Checkers, DisplayPanel, HUMANPlayer, RANDOMPlayer, Utils

    public interface CheckerBoardConstants
    This interface is used to store the different constants that you may need when coding for this assignment.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BLACK_KING
      This is the short way of refering to a black king since all pieces should always be on a gray background
      static int BLACK_KING_GRAY_BACKGROUND
      This represents a black king on a square with a gray background
      static int BLACK_KING_WHITE_BACKGROUND
      This represents a black king on a square with a white background
      static int BLACK_PAWN
      This is the short way of refering to a black pawn since all pieces should always be on a gray background
      static int BLACK_PAWN_GRAY_BACKGROUND
      This represents a black pawn on a square with a gray background
      static int BLACK_PAWN_WHITE_BACKGROUND
      This represents a black pawn on a square with a white background
      static int BLACK_PLAYER
      This represents the black player option and is used to indicate that a square is occupied by the black player
      static int BLANK
      This is the short way of refering to a blank square that a piece may move to since all pieces should always be on a gray background
      static int BLANK_GRAY_BACKGROUND
      This represents a blank gray square on the checkerboard
      static int BLANK_WHITE_BACKGROUND
      This represents a blank white square on the checkerboard
      static int BOARD_HEIGHT
      This is the number of squares high the checkerboard is
      static int BOARD_PIXEL_HEIGHT
      This is how tall our JPanel is going to have to be in pixels
      static int BOARD_PIXEL_WIDTH
      This is how wide our JPanel is going to have to be in pixels
      static int BOARD_WIDTH
      This is the number of squares wide the checkerboard is
      static int BORDER_SIZE
      This is the number of cells between the edge of the JPanel and the checkerboard panel in squares.
      static int INVALID_MOVE
      This is the value returned by the validMove method in the Utils class when a move is not valid
      static int NEITHER_PLAYER
      This represents the neither player option and is used to indicate that a square is not occupied by either player
      static int RED_KING
      This is the short way of refering to a red king since all pieces should always be on a gray background
      static int RED_KING_GRAY_BACKGROUND
      This represents a red king on a square with a gray background
      static int RED_KING_WHITE_BACKGROUND
      This represents a red king on a square with a white background
      static int RED_PAWN
      This is the short way of refering to a red pawn since all pieces should always be on a gray background
      static int RED_PAWN_GRAY_BACKGROUND
      This represents a red pawn on a square with a gray background
      static int RED_PAWN_WHITE_BACKGROUND
      This represents a red pawn on a square with a white background
      static int RED_PLAYER
      This represents the red player option and is used to indicate that a square is occupied by the red player
      static int SQUARE_HEIGHT
      This is the height of a checker board square in pixels
      static int SQUARE_WIDTH
      This is the width of a checker board square in pixels
      static int VALID_MOVE
      This is the value returned by the validMove method in the Utils class when a move is valid
      static int VALID_MOVE_BUT_INCOMPLETE
      This is the value returned by the validMove method in the Utils class when a move is valid, but not complete because it can jump more pieces or make a single first move without jumping pieces.

        static final int SQUARE_WIDTH
        This is the width of a checker board square in pixels

      • BORDER_SIZE

        static final int BORDER_SIZE
        This is the number of cells between the edge of the JPanel and the checkerboard panel in squares. This means the boarder around the checkerboard is 1 square wide.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
